Package Utils

Class Messanger

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utils.Messanger

  • public class Messanger
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be used to recorde sequences of errors. A Messanger has a type, for example DataErrors, and a stack of Messages, which themselves are lists. A typical intended application works as follows: The program starts executing a piece of code where user inputs are analysed, and several errors may be detected. Bofore starting the piece of code, it fetches a DataError messanger and calls push(context), where 'context' describes the situation where errors may occur. Then the piece of code is executed, and several errors may be inserted. After finishing the execution, the program calls pop() to get and remove the sequence of error messages. Inside the piece of code one may call push(into)-pop() sequences again.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Messanger.Messages
      This class comprises the data of one stack element in the messageStack
      static class  Messanger.MessangerType
      can be used to distinguish different message types.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void insert​(java.lang.String messageType, java.lang.String message)
      inserts a message into the top-element of the stack, if there is a top-element.
      void insertCompilationError​(java.lang.String code, java.lang.Exception exception)
      inserts an error resulting from a Groovy compilation
      void join​()
      joins the two top-elements of the stack.
      Messanger.Messages peek​()
      returns the last Messages-list from the stack
      Messanger.Messages pop​()
      pops the Messages-list from the stack
      boolean popIfEmpty​()
      if the last element on the messages stack is empty, it is removed, otherwise nothing is changed.
      void push​(java.lang.String context)
      pushes a new Message-List on the stack

      • popIfEmpty

        public boolean popIfEmpty​()
        if the last element on the messages stack is empty, it is removed, otherwise nothing is changed.
        Returns:
        true if the last element on the message stack is empty.

        message - the actual message.
